Articles.Content: NASA\'s Mar\'s rover Curiousity should be landing on Aug 5. I recently began reading about the complexities associated with sending a rover to Mars and it was and is truly fascinating. Here is a short 5minute video on just the broad spectrum engineering hurdles to get the rover on Mars. Hope you enjoy!

While Googling on the Mars topic and trying to find more cool links to show you guys i came across this article showing a panorama taken by Mars rover Opportunity. It contains 817 images all put together to make one awesome view. Just image if we had kept the funding for NASA where we could be today.

Source: http://www.jpl.nasa.gov/news/news.cfm?release=2012-196

They were expected to run up to a year, yet they past that, Spirit died last year, yet Opportunity still goes on. Nine years, and going strong! NASA, the reason why the American scientific establishment was so strong.

They were expected to run up to a year, yet they past that, Spirit died last year, yet Opportunity still goes on. Nine years, and going strong! NASA, the reason why the American scientific establishment was so strong.

I wish NASA made my car. Based on those numbers I wouldn\'t have to do any maintenance on it, ever.

Actually, you would need to do a lot of maintence. Spirit after landing, suffered two weeks of problems with her programming.
